column4: sudo dls -f ext /dev/sda > outputimage says Invalid magic value (not an EXTxFS file system (magic))
why would you use /dev/sda (the whole disk)?  Don't you want /dev/sda1 or something like that?
/dev/sda is the whole disk, /dev/sda1 is a partition on the disk
sometimes a whole disk has a filesystem on it, but very rarely.  Most always it is a partition that contains the filesystem.
cfdisk /dev/sda
ok it says sda1=Boot Primary and sda5= logical
so, you probably want to use /dev/sda5
but there is an sda sda1 sda2 and sda5  cfdisk doesn't say anything about sda2
sda2 is probably the "extended partition" that houses the "logical drives" of which sda5 is the first.
You can't use an "extended partition" directly.
sda5 is contained within sda2 which is contained within sda
The filesystem should be on sda5.
couldn't determind file system type using sda5
file /dev/sda5
block special
sorry, file -s /dev/sda5
linux/i386 swap file (new style)
Okay, so you must actually have wanted /dev/sda1 in that case.
what does 'host server' tell you?
Put an entry for 'server' in /etc/hosts
So that it doesn't go ask the ISP who 'server' is.
